Presentation

Dear McDonald's Singapore, 

I have been going to McDonald's for as long as I can remember. And McDonald's was my favorite childhood restaurant. Do note, that I had no conflict and dissatisfaction with McDonald's until recently.

I encountered a McDelivery Man who was not only rude, but also intimidating. He acted like a thug demanding for answers even before the purchase was complete. Yes, I was late by 15 mins as I was held up at work and my office is far from the guard house. A friend of mine who was at the scene was so frightened that this experience have discouraged her from ordering from McDonald's. I could understand if one is in a bad mood, but his actions were evident that he should not be working in a customer service environment. I was taken aback by such unruly behavior and made a complaint via email on 25th June 2012. 

The response given from McDonald's Customer Care Unit that the relevant personnel will be in touch with me within 5 working days starting from 25th June. On 27th July (More than 1 month after the complain), I emailed ops@sg.mcd.com since I have yet to receive any kind of response. And till today, 5th September 2012, I have yet to receive any contact from your side. I am terribly disappointed with the service that was given. Not just from the delivery man, but also the radio silence that I received from you side.

From a truly disappointed McDonald's Customer.

Everytime

'Get saving today' is like saying 'start saving today'. Nothing wrong with the English. It's like saying 'Get going'. :)

Problem is, "Get going" isn't official, like how "wanna" or "kinda" isn't official and is considered street slang.

So instead of spreading the message of speaking English well, McD has brought themselves down by allowing such "English" to win.

In all manner of proper spoken ad written English, "Get saving" makes no sense whatsoever.

It’s your last chance to win some exclusive Coca-Cola memorabilia! 

To enter this week’s Coca-Cola photo competition, just snap a photo of the Charcoal glass, the last design in the limited edition set of 6 Coca-Cola glasses! Send your photos in to mcdolympicscokeglass@gmail.com!

Terms and Conditions:
• Consent must be obtained for the photo submission if the participant is not the subject of the photo entry, and if the subject is below 18 years of age, from his /her parent or legal guardian.
• All photos submitted will be vetted by McDonald’s prior to posting.
• McDonald’s reserves the right to reject and not post any entries deemed to contain any inappropriate content at its sole discretion.
• McDonald’s decision on the winning entry is final and no correspondences will be entertained.
• Prizes are offered on a ‘no refund and no exchange’ basis.
• You will indemnify McDonald’s fully for any alleged or actual infringement of intellectual property rights or such other third party rights in respect of your photo entry.
• You will not hold McDonald’s liable for any damages or losses (monetary or otherwise) suffered by you from your participation in this contest
